website_summaries.verdict: Occasional flaws and the need for additional purchases keep this budget-priced device out of our "Best Bang for your Buck" category.
pros: Affordable and easy to set up/use
Monitors up to 3 remote locations at a time
cons: Additional sensors needed to maximize product
Indoor unit does not hang up
must sit on a table or shelf

website_summaries.verdict: Consider it if you like to monitor more than just the temperature but don't want a bunch of fancy features.
pros: Simple to set up and program
Reports various weather conditions and alerts with a high degree of accuracy
cons: Occasionally disconnects from the sensor, resulting in a "searching" message
Some units have been reported to stop working after a few months

customer_reviews.title: JUNK! Only lasted 7 months!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit in March. It suddenly stopped working. And yes I tried putting new batteries in and resetting; it's still not working. OS used to be a great product but now they clearly suck. And good luck getting help from customer service despite the fact it's under warranty. Dont waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Randolph

customer_reviews.title: After 3 years of use, unit does not communicate with 3 remote units
customer_reviews.text: Unit was great the first 12 months, battery life reasonable, but beginning at about 3 years the remote units started to not communicate with the central unit, even if they were within a few feet. Resetting all units didn't help. I'm disappointed as I had an Oregon Scientific travel clock that lasted nearly 20 years before the internal light failed. OK if you don't mind replacing it more frequently than is acceptable to me.
customer_reviews.author: Last Snow

customer_reviews.title: No longer quality product
customer_reviews.text: Had original unit that worked flawlessly for 16 years. Bought new one to replace. The main unit worked one year despite changing batteries and resetting several times. It will now come on after batteries changed and resetting for one minute, then goes dead. The sensor still works. Very disappointed as I enjoyed the original product for years. The website only instructs to change batteries and reset and if it doesn't work, then buy a new one. NOT
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working!
customer_reviews.text: We've always love Oregon Scientific products. This was to replace one we had for 8 yrs., we loved it at first. It's easy to read. But in less than four months it does not work...we've put in two sets of new batteries to no avail. Very disappointed! It's a waste of our money...and too late to return. In my opinion, no matter whether something is expensive or not it should last a lot more than 3 months. This was not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnne

customer_reviews.title: If looking for accuracy, buy it! Looks nice too!
customer_reviews.text: I did quite a bit of research deciding what thermometer to buy and what I really liked about this one is that, as far as I can tell,it is the most accurate thermometer compared to others it's price and a little ways above. Despite some of the reviews of it being hard to read I haven't had an issue with it. I mean who needs to read it from 30 ft away? It displays all the measurements in really nice concise groups that make sense! Very simple set up! Had no problem with getting the signal to connect between the sensor and the display! I love it and would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Does not connect to additional remote sensors
customer_reviews.text: I had an Oregon Scientific multi sensor weather station. After 9 years the base station gave up. So I bought his one, thought it would connect to my remote sensors. I didn't. I thought, maybe they changed channel or something and bought a brand new additional remote sensor. Didn't connect either. Returned it, will check out another brand. Also, the display is kind of hard to read from an angle.
customer_reviews.author: The Engineer

customer_reviews.title: No support for a faulty product.
customer_reviews.text: Oregon Scientific has poor tech support and customer service (almost none). Product worked sporadically and then didn’t. For a while, it required constant re-setting to reconnect to the remote signal and eventually just didn’t. It last five years but never worked smoothly. Not very long for such an expensive product. Product description says 2 AA batteries. It actually uses 3, but who’s counting. Some of their products work well (we have two others received as gifts). Not this. Very expensive for what it does.
customer_reviews.author: TonySueB

customer_reviews.title: Five Years On -- Still Works Wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: Just realized that I've had this running continuously now for five years. It of course synchronizes with the broadcast atomic clock signals. Its has travelled all over North America in my RV. Has endured interior temperatures as low as 45F and as high as 115F (yep) with the exterior sensor sustaining extremes of -15F and 120F. I've only needed to replace the batteries perhaps twice in five years. Would I buy another? I don't think I'll ever need to. If the need arises to add another, perhaps, but it is, so far, dead accurate and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: John Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for a while
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for about a year and a half. Then outside temp stopped displaying. Replaced batteries. Now it's intermittent, about 50% of the time it's there. There are cheaper options, try one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great promise.poor results.
customer_reviews.text: The time setting kept reverting to Pacific time - I live on the east coast. The outside sensor was much less sensitive than the much older, cheaper sensor I was replacing, and kept needing to be reset - which is very inconvenient, needing a tiny screwdriver to remove 3 tiny screws and a paperclip to press the reset. After a week of exasperation I returned it to Amazon. The promise for the unit was great but the delivery was poor quality and poor practical engineering.
customer_reviews.author: William McGonigle

customer_reviews.title: beware of weird tiny screws
customer_reviews.text: We could not unscrew the back of the outdoor sensor to put batteries in because it was held shut by 5 tiny screws that none of our tiny screwdrivers could open. The instructions showed a model that had a back that slid off, not the one we had. Maybe just a fluke but we're returning it and don't want another one.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I have had this weather station for a few weeks now. I love it! It is very easy to read, unlike most monochromatic displays. The numbers are large and easily read from a distance, even the smaller ones. All buttons are on the front of the device, making them wicked easy to locate. The back light, the large center button, is easily found. The back light lights the entire screen for about 10 seconds. All in all, a great weather station.
customer_reviews.author: Z-cat mom

customer_reviews.title: Oregon Scientific Unresponsive!
customer_reviews.text: The product is very good. It was designed to read 3 sensors. It’s to bad that Oregon Scientific can only supple the one that came with the unit. It’s been several months. In my opinion it’s a poor way to do business!
customer_reviews.author: RJK

customer_reviews.title: Very dim display and poor accuracy
customer_reviews.text: First, the display was very difficult to read. You had to be very close and looking from above to be able to read the data. Also, the readings were not very accurate. It was reading about 3 deg F higher on indoor temperature than actual. Overall, just not impressed at all.
customer_reviews.author: utche96

customer_reviews.title: Well made, not so user friendly
customer_reviews.text: This weather station seems well made with sturdy components. The sensor didn't work when I first put batteries in it, but I found it was due to the metal contacts in the unit which had to be adjusted so they touched the batteries. This should not be necessary and would not be obvious to everyone. The atomic clock was not receiving the signal at first, but finally made the connection after a few days. Overall this unit works well. The down side is setting up and adjusting all the modes is not user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: First, this replaces an old unit where the buttons are very hard to make function. As soon as I installed batteries in the main unit it picked up my old transmitter, so now I have 2 transmitters to use and can monitor other locations. The orange backlight is sufficient. It would be better to have a few bulbs on top, but not a problem. Second, some reviews say it's difficult to see. This is true if you try to view straight on. However, look at the design, this is meant to sit on a coffee table or lower area and when viewed from a 40 - 60 degree down angle it looks fine.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: It's a good concept but sadly poor results
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a very short time. Then it started to omit the temperature readings. It's a good concept but sadly poor results.
customer_reviews.author: pablo romero

customer_reviews.title: Quality isn’t what it used to be
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had Oregon Scientific Weather stations before and always thought they were reliable. Had one for about 10 years and finally had to replace it 2 years ago. I just had to get a new one because the outdoor sensor went bad, and of course you can’t get a replacement sensor now. Messed with the new one on and off for two days trying to get the sensor to sync. Was ready to send it back and suddenly it synced. Now two more days and its not reading. Gone through eveything again - several times. Ready to send it back, but of course we’ve now pitched all the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Only one complaint...
customer_reviews.text: I would like to hang the inside unit on a wall, but it is packaged to stand on a desk or counter. Other than that, it is an outstanding weather product, producing a clear display of current temperature and humidity, as well as predictions for weather during the next twelve hours. The best feature for me, though is the clock feature, which synchronizes with the national time broadcasts. If we lose power (which we do periodically), the unit keeps the time current and displayed, even when local power is out and we have no internet connection. Aside from the complaint (which is why I gave it four stars instead of five), the product is in a class by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Old Timer Too

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use weather station
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit for use at our cabin. I have two probes out side one up by the cabin and one about 100ft away at the water front. Works great. i did not rate tech support because I find this unit so easy to use I have not needed to contact anyone about it.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Outside unit died at 28 months
customer_reviews.text: It was helpful and seemed accurate, while it lasted. I reckon a 28 month life span for something made in China, vice Oregon, at $1.78 per month, isn't a great deal, but whuddya gunna do? I think I'll replace it with a different brand and roll the dice, once again.
customer_reviews.author: P&K S

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set-system..
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband and son to replace a LaCross that was difficult to sync and keep working. My husband and I set this one up very quickly...synced up to the receiver after we put in the batteries and the atomic clock came up quickly as well. We like the large numbers on the front. Not so fond of the amber light and background is not bright, so you have to pick up and look straight on to see the numbers....an improvement is needed in this area to make it a 5 star. Otherwise, it is an easy system with large numbers. Working well so far and have had working for several weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: Sharron

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a good unit, easy to set up and gives accurate readings. The only drawback is that is will not display time and date at the same time like other units I have had. Overall a good value.
customer_reviews.author: 24seven

customer_reviews.title: Substandard reception
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it would work for what I need, but the remote sensor works for a while then disconnects. Doesn't seem to comeback. I even tried having the remote sensor in the same room as the receiver, no joy. Also the Atomic clock feature which was a selling point for me only connects (after a long time) if I place in near a west facing window, in New England. The manual states you need to be within 2000 miles of Fort Collins, Colorado. According to USA Geo website I am 1760+ miles away, so I guess I should be prepared for weak signals.
customer_reviews.author: BeanTownUser

customer_reviews.title: Can only be read in good light
customer_reviews.text: I have had great luck with Oregon Scientific for years. When the remote station of my faithful old LaCrosse quit working, I decided to get this model from Oregon Scientific. It is truly a great unit except for one thing--the dark faceplate. My LaCrosse could be read across the bedroom without a problem, even in dim light. The Oregon Scientific can only be read when the overhead light is turned on because of the dark faceplate. Being basically lazy and wanting to see what the temperature outside is before I get out of bed, I find this aggrevating. I may be giving this one away and going back to the LaCrosse that I can read with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Nesbit

customer_reviews.title: Failed like many others.
customer_reviews.text: The unit worked fine for approximately18 months. However, it failed like many others as it will not receive transmissions from the transmitter. We have two older Oregon Scientific units that continue to work with the same transmitters.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a unit that we had for 5+ years that finally died. This unit will no longer sync with the base station. Technically it is still under warranty but it's not worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Jack v

customer_reviews.title: I/O thermometer
customer_reviews.text: This item came in partially working or partially broken---your choice. Actually the humidity function on the outside sensor doesn't work so I called Oregon S and they said they would send me another. Humidity is not very important to me so it's no biggie. I have not even filed a problem yet with Amazon. I will wait till 5-7 more days past. Looks good and does what it's supposed to do. The customer service lady was nice to talk to. She spoke good English! A plus!
customer_reviews.author: coontie57

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have all the data onscreen.
customer_reviews.text: Like that it has humidity measurements of the remote sensors. Not sure the radio clock synching is working very well. Forecast is useless and takes up space given how little data it has to go on. Range isn't great with stone walls.
customer_reviews.author: n/a

customer_reviews.title: Weather Station is great!
customer_reviews.text: Looks and works like advertised - I'm very happy with it! Nice large easy to read numbers, and an arrow button to toggle through the three available remote monitors, of which it comes with one included. (I ordered an additional one and both work fine.) Quality seems good, and no complaints so far after approx. 1 month of use. The lighted display comes in handy to illuminate all the readings when surrounding room lights are off, and stays on for approx. 5~6 seconds when the light button is pushed. The main reason I bought this one is for the outdoor humidity sensor, in which I had a cheaper brand before that didn't last long at all.
customer_reviews.author: G2Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great weather station!
customer_reviews.text: Works well, very easy to read. The ice warning light is very bright. Mine is located in our kitchen area, but if located in a bedroom, the ice warning light may be annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Ya nosh

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to sync, but now working well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband. We were ready to return it as we couldn’t get the atomic clock to sync. We followed the directions in the manual, reset it numerous times, and tried calling the customer service number in the manual, which was no help. As a last ditch effort, my husband reset it one more time and put it on the roof facing west, within an hour it had synced. Hope this helps someone else! We are very happy with it now that it is working correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Ranieri

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: We have several Oregon Scientific weather stations, including an old one like this one. I bought this on to replace a broken one. It picked up the time in a day or so as expected, but NEVER reported the outside temperature no matter which channel was selected, which is its main utility.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M Chused

customer_reviews.title: It's cold outside unless it's hot.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these weather stations. I don't know why I'm so obsessed with knowing the outside temperature though. although my phone conveniently tells me the outside temperature I have a sneaking suspicion it's lying to me in an effort to take over the world and it is in a manner of speaking. My phone gets its information from a weather station in the middle of a local airport and this information is actually quite different from the temperature outside my house, plus I get a frost advisory.
customer_reviews.author: Dalekfodder

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: For what it cost (less than $40) it's a good little weather station. Easy to set up and install. Has nice extra features like indications of rising and falling temps and humidity and its 12 hour forecast has been more accurate than the local TV weather. I mounted the outdoor sensor as instructed, up and protected by an overhang. It reads just a few degrees hotter in the afternoon than the actual air temp because it's close to an expansive concrete drive that heats up with direct afternoon sun. It's been in operation for about a month and is a good little unit. Now it's just a question of how long it and it's remote will last over time.
customer_reviews.author: DMA3

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Unit Owned
customer_reviews.text: Can't get the unit to synch with the atomic clock in Boulder, Colorado and can't manually change the time zone to Mountain time. Otherwise it works fine
customer_reviews.author: WC

customer_reviews.title: Be careful-
customer_reviews.text: stopped working after 2 weeks. won't come on. sensor seems to still be working. I tried several different sets of new batteries. (tested in a flashlight to be sure batteries were good) Screen was blank, light won't come on. Tossed it. Not buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Bumperb

customer_reviews.title: Good for 1 day
customer_reviews.text: Received June 28,2017 set up and working on the 29th, quit working on the 30th. Sent back for refund,will try another brand. Don't waste your money;
customer_reviews.author: Walt Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit
customer_reviews.text: Having previously had one of their older weather stations that lasted for 10 years before the outdoor sensor died, I felt relatively comfortable purchasing this one. I also hoped that the new unit's outdoor sensor would transmit on the same freq as the old one, allowing me to have two indoor displays of the environment outside, but, alas, it does not. They must have changed freq's. It took almost a day for the clock to synch with the National Standard Time Signal broadcast by WWV, but other than that, and the freq change, the new unit is great. LCD display is easy to read from a distance. No regrets after two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Larry in FL

customer_reviews.title: Confusing display; inaccurate readings
customer_reviews.text: This product has a very confusing display with tons and tons of stuff scattered everywhere. If you want to know "what's the temp?" or "will it rain?", there are moon phases, humidity readings,and lots of other stuff to sort through first. It also gave rather inaccurate readings, with clearly incorrect temperature readings. It couldn't even keep the clock on the right time! I would not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jon / NYC

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor unit doesn’t last long.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this Jan 2018 now in Feb. 2019, the outside sensor has decided that it is 115°. I’ve pulled the batteries, reset the unit and changed channels. Nothing fixes it. Like other reviews, the outdoor units seem to quit after a year or so. Not a great endorsement for the quality of Oregon Scientific. I had a previous one that lasted for years and was accurate, this one not so much.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great "Atomic" Clock and Weather Station
customer_reviews.text: Our old Oregon Scientific clock/weather station finally gave up, selected this model to replace it. This one doesn't display baro pressure but has a much better display, including a backlight. WWV signal is weak here for some reason, but eventually synced up for perfect time. Indoor and outdoor temp and humidity is something added with this model. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great weather station
customer_reviews.text: We had an Oregon Scientific weather station for years that finally stopped showing the display when viewed directly in front. Bought this model. So easy to set up and immediately communicated with the previously owned sensors. The product is well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my old base unit that was failing with this ...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old base unit that was failing with this one. Was able to use the old sensors I've had for years. Since putting this all together, one of those doesn't connect anymore after changing the sensor battery. It's still getting room temps, but doesn't report into the base unit. I might replace that sensor sometime in the next several months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best weather watch.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Oregon Scientific weather forecast. When the heat hit 115 degrees, the first one quit reporting. I really missed not being able to check the outdoor temperature and inside humidity. Very easy to use. The forecast to the left gives me an idea of what's coming. Replaces a kitchen clock and timer.
customer_reviews.author: Katge

customer_reviews.title: Accurate but the display could be better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an Accurite weather station that was neither accurate nor right. The sensors on this unit agree to within 0.9 degrees Fahrenheit which is what I expect. The accurite was 6 degrees off. I like everything about this unit except that it has a fairly low contrast display making it difficult to read in low light and you cannot hang up the main unit. However these are fairly minor problems.
customer_reviews.author: Math AddictTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: 13 years of owning Oregon Scientific weather stations. This ...
customer_reviews.text: 13 years of owning Oregon Scientific weather stations. This is the third and last. Product quality has steadily declined over those years... the first station lasted 8 years, the second 4, and this one 7 months!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good weather stations
customer_reviews.text: Had heard that the Oregon Scientific weather stations perform will and are acurate. The BAR208HGA is good and accurate in both time and data readings. It worked flawlessly from the beginning. Its drawback for us - our age is the late 60's early 70's, found the display contrast, although large, hard to read except under just the right conditions. The backlight feature for subdued ambient light, initiates a salmon pink color which makes the display totally unreadable. It is working fine now that we turn the bright lights on and stand at the right angle.
customer_reviews.author: David Hogg

customer_reviews.title: We dropped and broke a Brookstone weather station that had ...
customer_reviews.text: We dropped and broke a Brookstone weather station that had worked perfectly for 10 years. It had cost $39 and had a light bar on top that showed the forecast by changing colors. It was much more accurate than the weatherman. Of course, they don't make that one anymore. This one is much bigger. It has no forecast function, just tells you what the temp and humidity is indoors and outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Larger than my original one by same company
customer_reviews.text: It took a couple of resets for the monitor to recognize the outdoor sensor. Working fine now for weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Fine product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item to have at home if you're interested in keeping up with the weather. Set up is extremely easy, and the display is bright and legible. Weather data seem to be a wee bit off, compared with what I get with a rather expensive (many hundreds of dollars) Davis Vantage Pro weather station, but the discrepancy is almost certainly due to different locations of the two outside temperature sensors. It's an attractive unit and would be a fine addition to one's home, or a great and rather inexpensive gift for some other weather-watcher.
customer_reviews.author: Marshal Shlafer

customer_reviews.title: Oregon Scientific BAR208HGA Advanced Weather Station
customer_reviews.text: This is great for the person who wants to know the outside temperature without going outside. It has added features such as inside temperature, humidity and the time. The display is a little difficult to read because it is black on a darker gray background. I probably wouldn't have noticed this, but I previously had an Oregon Scientific that was black on a light gray background. It does have a light mode which helps, but you probably wouldn't need it except at night.
customer_reviews.author: K.M. Kautz

customer_reviews.title: We like it except for the annoying freeze warning light that ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. We like it except for the annoying freeze warning light that come on and blinks all night. We keep the device in the bathroom next to the bed room. The dumb light would blink all night and keep lighting up the room. Very annoying, so I solved the problem by opening the device and disconnecting the light. Everything else is great and we like the display etc.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Works Well Except for Moon Phase
customer_reviews.text: The BAR-208S set up with modest effort, acquired its sensor successfully and performed as advertised EXCEPTING the lunar phase display, which is determined to be 14 days out of sync; e.g., showing a new moon on March 2nd, 2018 when it was full and predicting the next full moon on March 16th when the new moon occurs on the 17th and the next full moon March 31st. No reply yet from Oregon Scientific on this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: To know what the temp. and the humidity in and out side are
customer_reviews.text: We had a unit for more than 15 years but needed to replace the outside unit. We like the product, as it informs us whether the air conditioner is still working properly
customer_reviews.author: A.J.ekelmans

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Broke within a month. Tried re-setting it, etc. etc. etc. I kept it. It still is able to give the temp and humidity outside and inside but none of the other features work.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice easy to use weather station.
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaced a similar unit by another Mfg. It is working just fine and is relatively easy to read. The built in light is also a handy feature for checking readings after dark.
customer_reviews.author: William E. Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware! Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: I tried resetting the outdoor thermometer a dozen times, but it would only work when it was within a 1-2 foot range from the base unit. Totally unacceptable! Obviously a defective unit, but I waited too long...the warranty/return period had already expired. My previous unit only lasted two years...
customer_reviews.author: Merlin

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it!
customer_reviews.text: Have used other brands and nothing beats this one. I have one in both my houses and have also given them as gifts. Can't really vouch for the accuracy of the humidity sensor, but the temperature sensors and radio clock are spot on. If you call the Naval Observatory master clock it will exactly match the radio clock on this unit. One thing it could use is a way to mount the inside unit on a wall, instead of only being able to sit it on a horizontal surface...
customer_reviews.author: Jomama

customer_reviews.title: A Great Weather Station
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this weather station to use with my garden hot-box. I put the remote transmitter in a sealed glass jar and placed it on the ground in the hot-box with the steel lid facing up. I was quite surprised that it works so well considering that I used aluminum clad foam insulation panels on all sides of the box to keep the cold out. The top of the hot-box was covered with 4 old aluminum storm windows. We can monitor the temperatures in the hot-box from our kitchen, which is about 30 feet from the hot-box.
customer_reviews.author: Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Product did not work. Could not reach supplier for tech support. Returned. Will replace with another brand. Organ Scientific once was a great product...no longer.
customer_reviews.author: LLW

customer_reviews.title: Moon phase
customer_reviews.text: The moon phase lighting is opposite of what it really is. The lighted part is the dark part of the moon and the dark part is the bright part of the moon. I have tried to change it but I have not been successful. Everything else looks fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Terry J Klein

customer_reviews.title: Particularly like that it shows both inside and outside temperatures on ...
customer_reviews.text: More detailed information than my last one. Particularly like that it shows both inside and outside temperatures on the face, without having to press a button.
customer_reviews.author: Dezz

customer_reviews.title: Gave it as a gift...
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my Father for Christmas and from what I hear from my Mom, he "loves his new toy"! My mother is an avid gardener with a hot house to handle the crazy winters in central Texas. My dad set it up so he can monitor the temps in the hot house from the main house. This makes it so much easier on him so he doesn't have to hike down to the hot house in the nasty weather to put on the propane heater if he doesn't have to. He's getting a second transmitter for his birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Karin C.

customer_reviews.title: Great weather station...terrible price flucuation.
customer_reviews.text: I have given three of these as gifts. They all loved them, then I finally bought one for myself. IIt is now the end of 2016 and I was going to purchase two more as gifts...BUT... the price for it has jumped by over $36.00 since two days ago. No Sale!
customer_reviews.author: franklin d. fletcher

customer_reviews.title: ... parents and it worked so well and was so easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my parents and it worked so well and was so easy to set up, I bought another for myself. For my use, I bought an extra sensor and it works ok. It's a fair distance from each sensor so I had to put the main base in a spot that's not all that convenient for it to see both. Plus it has to read through stucco walls which I think hurts the signal strength. Overall, very good weather station.
customer_reviews.author: D. C.

customer_reviews.title: like older unit better
customer_reviews.text: My older units remote sensor quit working, and Oregon Sci didn't have a replacement. So I purchased a new unit to replace it. I very dissapointed in the display. My older unit had a dark background that illustrated information prominently. The new unit has a much lighter background that makes the display very hard to read.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Sellitti

customer_reviews.title: Would not sync with satellite
customer_reviews.text: I own an older model OS weather station and it has worked perfectly for many years. I ordered this one to place in my bedroom. After many days and trying many locations I gave up on trying to get this one to sync to the satellite for the atomic clock and returned the unit. I got zero help from OS customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce S

customer_reviews.title: Atomic Time Keeping
customer_reviews.text: It is a great little unit, nice big numbers and the set up was very easy. Basically put the batteries in it, it picked up the signal right away and has worked perfect. Has a lot of great features, found a new one I didn't know it had. High humidity outside and it turned on the "Fog Alert" and there really was fog that morning. It has a big button in the middle for your night light, its orange and really shows up well. Form, function and price its a winner in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Oregon Scientific weather station unit. The first one lasted quite a few years but the outside unit finally died. This one appears to be pretty much the same as the first one I had. So I now have two inside units and one outside unit. I expect that the outside unit would fail more often than the inside unit because it's out in the wet and heat. I just wish they would price the outside unit at a lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie Bernbaum

customer_reviews.title: I would have liked it had it worked
customer_reviews.text: Nice design, and would have been fine, except the remote sensor could not stay paired with the home unit. The signal kept dropping anytime the sensor was more than about two feet away. Returning for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: A. Barlow

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: this is replacing my old Oregon Scientific Advanced Wireless Weather Station. Old station which is about 10 yrs. old still displays correct temp. and time. Humidity display is no longer correct.
customer_reviews.author: Roger L Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate easy to read
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a station that showed inside as well as outside humidity. I was pleased with this brand before so I went with them again. It's not easy to read at odd angles but its meant to sit on your desk or at that sort of angle. It's got a light to help read it at night that's not going to blind you. I've found it to be accurate as well. It's nice that the outside unit also shows the temp. Easy to set up and comes with good instructions.
customer_reviews.author: KaseyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Weather Station
customer_reviews.text: I bought this weather station the first time about 18 months ago. I liked it so much that I bought another last month as a Christmas present for a good friend. We both really like this weather station. It is great, has the regular stuff, indoor and out door temp and humidity but it also has moon phase, weather forecast and messages. Unlike some weather stations this one operates for months on a single set of batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Carr

customer_reviews.title: love this thing
customer_reviews.text: what's the definition of a good value? for me, if i use it regularly and get what i want from it, then it's a success. this product achieves that in spades. we look at this multiple times a day (at least in the winter) to know what to expect when we open the door. it's always working, easy to read, and is very accurate. highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JCN3

customer_reviews.title: Great Weather Station to keep track of temperatures, inside and outside.
customer_reviews.text: This works well. I had a little trouble getting it set up, but it is working well now. This is the second Oregon Thermometer I have owned, the other one which is probable 12-15 years old still works (part time- doesn't pick up signals as well as it used to). It is nice to be able to see what the temperature is in the house, outside and I use one in the wellhouse to keep track of the temperature there also.
customer_reviews.author: Katy Nelson

customer_reviews.title: accurate, handy, easy to read
customer_reviews.text: handy, accurate -- if you put the sensor in the correct place, which means NOT in the blazing sun, NOT in the shade. Be smart. It'll serve you well if you follow the written directions. Easy to use, to see, and not unattractive to look at. Push-light could stay on longer, but that's just how it was designed, brief illumination. So maybe you hit the button twice instead of once. No biggie
customer_reviews.author: NelleTex

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement of my old one, really did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Design has problems
customer_reviews.text: When I pick it up, it is normal for me to take hold of the bottom, when I do, I manage to squeeze one of the bottom arrows which usually causes me to lose the outside temperature. I think it works well if you don't touch it and when I call the "help" phone number they are quick to answer and very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: This weather station gives accurate temperatures, both inside and out, so I can see if I can open the sliding doors to my patio without the A/C or heater coming on. The only thing I haven't been able to adjust is the clock. For some reason, it seems to be stuck at Mountain Time and will not adjust to EST. As I adjust easier than the clock, I just ad 3 hrs. :-)
customer_reviews.author: flaury

customer_reviews.title: Good Product good price
customer_reviews.text: This product works very well for me. First I placed the sensor out side my home in a small basket with lithium batteries in it. The base is In side my house on a cabinet In the Jan 2014 cold wave it measured -16 below zero which was the low for that day. Oregon products are very accurate. I have had them for years. This is my replacement that I highly recommend. Just as good as the old ones.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. North

customer_reviews.title: Our side temperature  gage.
customer_reviews.text: We made the purchase to replace an earlier model that had served us well.
customer_reviews.author: Ray E. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Faulty display
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the fifth product I have purchased from Oregon Scientific over the last 30 years. The display unit was faulty. Usually it's the outdoor sensors that give you trouble after years of exposure. Anyway, I returned it to Amazon for a quick and easy refund. In the end, I purchased replacement sensors to go with the display I already had. Overall Oregon Scientific products are well made.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Had a little trouble getting the clock to sync, but all is good. I wish it had a way to hang it on the wall. But I found the shelf that’ll work. Some nice features.
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money
customer_reviews.text: It never did work correctly. Only registered indoor temp - NO humidity. Outside only lasted 1 week - no temp, no humidity... clock worked.. but that's it! Save your money and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Eva S.

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Oregon Scientific BAR208HGA Advanced Weather Station with Atomic Time, works perfectly. The outdoor unit on my previous Oregon Scientific weather station was sending crazy humidity readings and I tried to buy a new one but realized I could buy an entire system for the same price! The nice part is now I have TWO base stations in my house reading the same outdoor unit. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: J. G.

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for my previous OS Weather Station. Awesome as expected!
customer_reviews.author: rt66runner

customer_reviews.title: Accurate time and temperature.
customer_reviews.text: The atomic clock is always accurate. The temperature is close to my other outdoor temperature devices. And you can read this one in the dark with the push-button light. I use this beside my bed so I can check the time and the outdoor temperature in the middle of the night - so I know when to get up and how to dress.
customer_reviews.author: JaytheGeek

customer_reviews.title: A good entry level buy
customer_reviews.text: Good pick-up for a novice. It's big and silver, and seems more attractive online. As for what it's meant to do, it's a steady performer. Accurate readings both inside and outside, as compared with other stations I own, and the giant display is very easy to read. Although some may argue viewing angles are not that great, but I say this is minor. A worthy starting point.
customer_reviews.author: W. Bickram

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: Our old portable weather station stopped working. So we purchased this one. We like it size, it's readability and the fact that we can see the key outside weather information from anywhere inside our house as long as we're not too far from the outside sensor. We liked it so much we bought two of them.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: It works great time will tell how the batteries do
customer_reviews.text: The Oregon Scientific was delivered on time as advertised, setup was simple the only thing I really had to do was get it set to the correct time zone as it comes with the Pacific time as default. It works great time will tell how the batteries do.
customer_reviews.author: Rich G

customer_reviews.title: Clock frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: Thought the automatic clock would be good but it kept flipping back to Colorado time. I couldn't keep it on eastern time. Otherwise works fine. Had to put tape over the ice light. Very annoying with the cold winter we had.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Parkinson

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I don't like about this product is it slants sightly backwards
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don't like about this product is it slants sightly backwards. Had it sitting on fireplace mantel and I could never see the numbers because of the slant. Had to move it and it works good. Just not able to display/put it where I want it to go.
customer_reviews.author: Debbeedo

customer_reviews.title: Great Weather Station
customer_reviews.text: This unit is a little larger than our old Oregon Scientific. The numbers are easier to read (great for aging eyes). I checked on Oregon Scientific to make sure our existing smaller units are compatible before I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Remote sensor was defective on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit and looks good. Unfortunately the remote sensor was defective on arrival. Call Oregon Scientific and went through the trouble shooting with no good results. It is packed up to go back to Amazon. Hard to rate a product that only half works, so I gave it half the stars.
customer_reviews.author: Recorder

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product, difficult Instructions
customer_reviews.text: This is a five star product, but I gave it four because of the instructions. They are a little difficult to follow, but I've discovered that with all the Oregon Scientific products I've had. After a couple of read-throughs and some tinkering, I finally figured out how to set the display correctly and the time-zone. Good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: TerryGe55

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I like it love the color display. It works great! But the forecast part of it is stuck never changes. The moon phase is couple of days off. Would like to find out why the forecast never changes. Other then that I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: OK - but not good enough
customer_reviews.text: This did almost all the things it said it would do - but - it's too big, the battery compartment on the remote unit is way too hard to open and there's no point to an atomic clock that doesn't pick up a signal and needs to be set (with difficulty) manually. And the moon phase also needs to be set manually as well. Needs improvement. The remote sensor did work and it did show the outside temperature, but the other features were not worth the size or bother.
customer_reviews.author: Bob W.

customer_reviews.title: Works With Radio Shack Weather Stations.
customer_reviews.text: The weather station works great. I purchased it because the display was identical to Radio Shack stations, which I was having problems with, and I thought that Oregon Scientific may have manufactured it for Radio Shack. The sending unit for the Oregon Scientific station works great with my Radio Shack stations.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, but the remote unit is hard coded to display Fahrenheit.
customer_reviews.text: Great unit, but be aware that the remote unit displays the temperature in Fahrenheit and there is no way to change it to Celsius. The base station temperature display is configurable and will display the temperature from the remote unit according to the setting you've chosen. It's a minor inconvenience unless you require the remote unit to display the temperature in Celsius.
customer_reviews.author: David

product_meta.title: Oregon Scientific BAR208HGX Advanced Wireless Weather Station with Temperature Forecast, Ice Alert, Self-setting Atomic Clock, Month/Day Calendar, Large LCD, Moon Phase, Silver
product_meta.description:
Color:Silver

Oregon Scientific BAR208HGA_S Model BAR208HG Advanced Wireless Weather Station with Temperature Forecast, Ice Alert, Self-setting Atomic Clock, Month/Day Calendar, Large LCD, Moon Phase, Silver

Everything you'll need to know to start your day off right is at your fingertips. With the weather forecast in graphical icons, you'll never wonder if you need an umbrella again. This weather station monitors indoor and outdoor temperature from up to 3 remote locations. You can put a sensor outside in your garden, in your wine cellar and your baby's room and read all that information from the comfort of your bedroom.


Key Features

 * Weather Forecast with graphical icons
 * Self-setting atomic clock in 12/24 hour format with time zone offset feature
 * Ice Alert with Green LED light
 * Month/Day calendar
 * Monitors Indoor and Outdoor temperature and humidity
 * Measure temperature from up to 3 remote locations (additional sensors required)
 * Min/Max Temperature memory
 * Weather trend icons bring trends to life
 * Large LCD
 * Orange EL Backlight for nighttime viewing
 * Moon Phase
 * Weather warning messages: Heat, Wind, Storm, Fog, and Frost


Main Unit Specifications

 * Dimensions: 3.7" x 2" x 7.1"
 * Weight: 0.53 Lbs
 * Temperature range: -5°C to 50°C (23°F to 122°F)
 * Resolution: 0.1°C (0.2°F)
 * Signal frequency: 433 MHz
 * Humidity range: 25% - 95%
 * Humidity resolution: 1%
 * Power: 3 x UM-3 (AA) 1.5 V batteries


Remote Unit Specifications

 * Dimensions: 1.9" x 0.8" x 3.7"
 * Weight: 0.13 Lbs
 * Transmission range: 30 m (98 ft) unobstructed
 * Temperature range: -20°C to 60°C (-4°F to 140°F)
 * Humidity range: 25% - 95%
 * Power: 1 x UM-3 (AA) 1.5 V battery



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Oregon Scientific’s most popular weather station! Compact, stylish, and easy to use. A true wireless digital weather station. The display unit and remote sensor (included) powers on standard AA batteries and will last for over a year without the need to change batteries. Monitor up to 4 locations, and up to 100 feet away. With graphical icons and weather alerts, the BAR208 will advise local weather warnings such as heat, wind, fog, and frost.
feature_bullets: Self-setting atomic clock in 12/24 hour format with time zone offset feature
Ice Alert with Green LED light
Monitors Indoor and Outdoor temperature and humidity

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars1,081 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
